AUGUSTINE Arts & Culture ARTIST PROFILES PUBLIC ART Cultural Trails Accord Trail Touch – Braille Trail Oldest In History Neighborhoods Neighborhoods Guide Organization Type Association/Club/Group Commercial Business Corporation Dance Educational Environmental Faith Based/Religious Festivals Film/Video Food/Drink Foundation Gallery/Museum Gift Shop Government History/Heritage Kids/Family Library Literature/Poetry Lodging Media Music Nonprofit Performing Arts Retail Sports/Outdoor Theatre Tours Traditional Arts Travel Visual Arts State / Province FL City/Town Armstrong Crescent Beach Elkton Fruit Cove Hastings Palm Coast Palm Valley Ponte Vedra Ponte Vedra Beach St. Augustine St. Augustine Beach St. Augustine Shores Switzerland Vilano Beach Zip/Postal Code 32004 32033 32080 32081 32082 32084 32085 32086 32092 32095 32135 32137 32142 32145 32164 32259 SEARCH Advanced Filters Home Organization Palm Valley Fish Camp Facebook Twitter Linkedin Print Palm Valley Fish Camp The owners of the fine-dining spot Marker 32, Ben and Liza, opened the Palm Valley Fish Camp near Ponte Vedra Beach in 2009. Located on the Intracoastal, Palm Valley Fish Camp is the result of Groshell’s vision to create a restaurant with a neighborhood feel, the freshest seafood, amazing views, and old favorite entrees with creative, new twists. This venue’s interior is as fresh and inviting as the catch of the day, and the light from the sun shimmers off the water as a simple gift just before the sun sets. The locals know exactly where to come to get that getaway feel right here at home. If the freshest oysters on the half shell and true southern seafood awaken your taste buds, stop in today for an unforgettable lunch or dinner with a lively atmosphere, knowledgeable and friendly service, and spectacular views. EMMA’s mission is to offer quality music and dance performances by national and international artists. They also aim to encourage interest in classical music and to provide opportunities for the youth of St. Johns County. EMMA accomplishes this by offering school concerts in local schools and funding requests from music teachers for instruments and equipment. Historic Florida Militia The Historic Florida Militia (HFM) is a non-profit umbrella organization supporting re-created historic interpretive units and representing a number of cultures and time periods. "We are not street performers, we are educators. We are not parades, we are historic programs. This is not an exercise in free speech, this is an opportunity to educate. We are not promoting a political agenda, we are promoting the city's history through a practical and factual teaching method". Crisp-Ellert Art Museum at Flagler College Built in honor of Dr. JoAnn Crisp-Ellert and her husband, Dr. Robert Ellert, the Crisp-Ellert Art Museum offers Flagler College students and the Northeast Florida community a venue for fostering knowledge and a deep appreciation of contemporary art. As an educational resource for the College, the Museum exhibits regional, national and international artists, and provides opportunities for critical engagement and exposure to a variety of exhibitions and personal interactions with visiting artists. The Museum challenges students, the Flagler community and the public to cultivate individual creativity, critical reflection, historical consciousness and respect for the free exchange of ideas. In this spirit, the Museum also hosts public programs, including artist talks, readings, panel discussions and film series that provide a platform for vital interdisciplinary dialogue. Besides our creative menu, our scenic view and lively atmosphere make us the perfect dining spot in Neptune Beach! If you haven’t dined at the North Beach Fish Camp recently, here is where you can get a picture of who we are here and what we’re all about.
